item.title: assembly-related
item.description:
asm & syscalls

move value into register:

1

mov rax, 60

dereference a pointer:

1

mov rdi, [1337000]

let the asm program executable:

1
2
3
4

.intel_syntax noprefix
.global _start
_start:
<asm_code>

exit():

1
2
3

mov rdi, <exit_code>
mov rax, 60
syscall

write():

1
2
3
4
5

mov rdi, <1_or_2>
mov rsi, <memory_addr>
mov rdx, <bytes>
mov rax, 1
syscall

read():

1
2
3
4
5

mov rdi, 0
mov rsi, <memory_addr>
mov rdx, <bytes>
mov rax, 0
syscall

assemble the program:

item.title: SpinalHDL Basics
item.description:
Examples

1
2

showRtl(new MyTop) //generate rtl, default Verilog
SpinalVerilog(new MyTop) //generate Verilog in current dir

in Spinal, Component is default, but type Module = Component is also okay
config Global Settings in SpinalConfig

Design Rules

never erase the previous assignment, except they’re in different blocks, or use a.allowOverride to allow this action

SpinalHDL will check the registers you used only depends on same/sync clock registers
fix: add the tag

1

val regB = clkB(Reg(UInt(8 bits))).addTag(crossClockDomain)

int height[N];
void init_set()
{
    for(int i = 1; i <= N; i++)
    {
        s[i] = i;
        height[i] = 0;
    }
}
void merge_set(int x, int y)
{
    x = find_set(x);
    y = find_set(y);
    if(height[x] == height[y])
    {
        height[x] = height[x] + 1;
        s[y] = x;
    }
    else
    {
        if(height[x] < height[y]) s[x] = y;
        else s[y] = x;
    }
}

#include<bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;
int a[1000];

void findsum(int *a, int n, int s)
{
	int i = 0, j = 0;
	int sum = a[0];
	while(j < n)
	{
		if(sum >= s)
		{
			if(sum == s) printf("%d %d\n", i, j);
			sum -= a[i];
			i++;
			if(i > j) { sum = a[i]; j++; }
		}
		if(sum < s) {j++; sum += a[j];}
	}
}

int main()
{
	int n; cin >> n;
	for(int i = 0; i < n; i++)
	{
		scanf("%d", &a[i]);
	}
	int s; cin >> s;
	findsum(a, n, s);
	return 0;
}

item.title: Csapp Chapter4
item.description:
4.1

prelude

PC holds the address of the instruction that currently executed.

registers, base pointer, stack pointer

condition code: ZF, SF, OF

memory(monolithic byte array)

Types of encoding the Y-86 instructions:

I-type, D-type and B-type

instructions

movq is split: I, R, M -> R, M

AL instructions: addq, subq, andq, xorq (as there is no zero register in Y-86 processor, you must add an xorq instruction)

jumps: jmp, <=, <, ==, !=, >=, >
